title: Secure Multi-Factor Authentication and Access Management
summary: Implement a secure login and authentication system with multi-factor verification to protect user accounts.
description: This epic establishes a secure authentication and access control mechanism for the banking self-service portal. It includes user registration and login, session management, and enforcement of multi-factor authentication using methods such as SMS/email OTPs, authenticator apps, or biometrics. The implementation ensures compliance with financial security regulations and employs encryption, anti-phishing, and session timeout measures to safeguard customer data and privacy.

title: Responsive and Accessible User Interface
summary: Design and develop a responsive, adaptive, and accessible portal interface for customers across devices.
description: This epic focuses on building a modern, user-centric interface that adapts seamlessly across different devices such as desktops, tablets, and mobile phones. The design will emphasize simplicity, ease of navigation, and compliance with accessibility standards. Interactive UI elements and consistent layouts will ensure optimal usability and visual consistency, delivering an inclusive experience for all customers.

title: Personalized Dashboard and Service Recommendations
summary: Develop a personalized dashboard that displays banking products, account summaries, and tailored recommendations.
description: This epic introduces a customer-specific dashboard that dynamically presents user account details, active services, and product recommendations based on eligibility and profile information. The dashboard will provide an overview of account balances, recent transactions, and key alerts, while also offering shortcuts to common actions. A personalization engine will leverage profile data to enhance customer engagement and accessibility.

title: Digital Account Opening and Service Modification Workflows
summary: Enable customers to open new accounts and modify existing services through streamlined digital workflows.
description: This epic implements guided digital workflows that allow customers to submit account opening requests and service modifications electronically. Each process will include form auto-population, input validation, and regulatory compliance checks. Customers can track progress as applications move from submission to approval stages. The workflows will prioritize convenience, ensuring minimal manual input and an efficient, paperless experience.

title: Save and Resume Unfinished Applications
summary: Allow users to save incomplete forms or requests and resume them later without losing progress.
description: This epic enables customers to pause any ongoing application or request workflows and return at their convenience to complete them. The system will continuously auto-save entered details, encrypt stored draft information, and allow resumption from the last completed step. This improves user flexibility, reduces frustration from session timeouts, and enhances the overall user experience.

title: Secure Document Upload and Management
summary: Provide a secure module for customers to upload and manage documents during service requests.
description: This epic introduces document upload functionality that supports identity verification and application processing. The system will validate uploaded files for format, size, and completeness while encrypting them for secure storage and transmission. Customers can attach necessary documentation through an intuitive interface, track upload statuses, and manage required documents directly within their active workflows.

title: Real-Time Request Tracking and Notifications
summary: Offer customers visibility into the status of their applications and notify them of updates in real-time.
description: This epic delivers a tracking system that provides customers with real-time visibility into the progress of their submitted account opening or service modification requests. The platform will automatically generate notifications through email and in-portal alerts whenever a status change occurs, such as under review, approved, or rejected. It enhances transparency and reduces customer dependency on support channels.

title: Comprehensive Interaction History and Audit Trail
summary: Maintain a complete log of customer activities, requests, and communication history.
description: This epic establishes a centralized history module that records all user activities, such as logins, transactions, document uploads, and request submissions. Customers can view their entire activity timeline within the portal, and administrators will have secure access to audit logs for tracking changes or resolving disputes. The data retention strategy ensures compliance with regulatory audit requirements while preserving data integrity.

title: Core Banking Integration Layer
summary: Integrate the self-service portal with the core banking system to ensure seamless data synchronization.
description: This epic focuses on building secure, reliable integration between the self-service portal and the bank’s core banking systems. Integration will be achieved through APIs and middleware that allow real-time synchronization for customer records, transactions, and service request statuses. Data will flow bi-directionally, ensuring accuracy, consistency, and responsiveness across connected systems while complying with security and operational standards.

title: Independent Portal Database and Performance Optimization
summary: Develop a dedicated, high-performance database for portal operations to ensure reliability and scalability.
description: This epic involves setting up an independent database architecture optimized for the portal’s responsiveness and high concurrency requirements. It separates portal operations from core banking workloads while maintaining data synchronization. The database will incorporate indexing, caching, and query optimization techniques to ensure smooth performance under heavy user loads. Continuous monitoring and automated failover systems will enhance reliability.

title: Role-Based Access Control and Authorization Management
summary: Implement role-based permissions to restrict and manage user access according to profiles.
description: This epic defines the implementation of a comprehensive role-based access control (RBAC) system. It assigns permissions based on user roles—customers, administrators, and auditors—ensuring each can access only relevant functions. The RBAC model enforces the principle of least privilege, securing sensitive data while meeting internal compliance and data governance standards through centralized authorization management.
